channel.title: After 5 years and $3M, here's everything we've learned from building Ghost
channel.description:
An interesting write-up:
[After 5 years and $3M, here's everything we've learned from building Ghost](https://blog.ghost.org/5/)

item.title: After 5 years and $3M, here's everything we've learned from building Ghost
item.dc:creator: nevf
item.description:
That’s one thing I took away. They caused more angst than freemium users, made worse because they have the abilities to contribute. The other take away was their enthusiasm for running as a not for profit.

Read full topic
item.source: After 5 years and $3M, here's everything we've learned from building Ghost

item.title: After 5 years and $3M, here's everything we've learned from building Ghost
item.dc:creator: rfctr
item.description:
andrey:

An interesting write-up

I can’t guess what part of it you found interesting, but what resonated with me is how open-source developers(!) similar in their demands to the users in app stores - making loud noises and organize the mobs. But very few of them actually go all-in and provide a patch to support their favourite feature.

Read full topic
item.source: After 5 years and $3M, here's everything we've learned from building Ghost
